instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
At first problem looks like a no turning on, becasu it takes for ever to chime, and fan don?t spin immediately. It actually chime after 25 seconds, always.
After that you get the apple logo and then the password screen, but only for a few seconds, because it turns off. Actually PPVcore and S0 rails turn off, I have 5V S3 and 3.3V S3, didn?t mesaure other lines. 
Fan never spins, but board never gets hot. And in the fan conector I have 5V before it turns off.

No liquid damage, boards looks really nice under the microscope.

What should I try next, SMC, RAM, CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
Fan starts very late on this board.
CPU needs to get really hot first.

Do few PRAM reset first.
But you should to clean ME region in BIOS.
Better to test with full new BIOS, with clean ME of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
I download a Bios, but with the one I download, the SSD don't work.
If I start with linux with USB it starts and never turn off, but with Mac OS in a USB it just loads forever, it doesn't turn off, but gets stuck in loading screen with the apple logo.

Do you have a BIOS I can try with this machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
Try this as is, just for test...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1geqoMbrYeofto52iPs50d_h4RHp_qZXw[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
Thanks for the Bios.

With your Bios, the Macbook chime inmediatelly and stay on, but didn't recognize any OS, the original SSD of the Macbook, shows the carpet question symbol, other good SSD shows the prohibition symbol.
But if I start with a USB stick with the installer it boots up, and in the utility disk it shows the SSD.

So I erase and isntall High Sierra in one of my test SSD, with that the machine now works fine. I upgrade firmware and install Mojave in my SSD, still works fine. My plan is to backup his info and erase and install all in his SSD,

So now I need to install a Bios with the serial number of the Macbbok. 
Is my first time doing this, any other step, after editing the bios with the serial number?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message: Copy entire Fsys block from your original BIOS to the new BIOS file (the updated one).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message: Sorry the ignorance, can you give me the the address of the blocks I have to copy, I ussually just search for the serial and change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message: Search this time for Fsys and also $SVS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> It takes 25 seconds to chime and turns off at 40 econds
threads.message:
Thanks, I copy those sector to the BIOS, after that didn?t recognize the OS, it recognize the SSD.
So I put my test SSD, and install Mojave to the Macbook. And now it detect all my SSD and SO. My guess is the installation writes something to the BIOS that gets lost or corruted when I change something in the BIOS.

At the end costumer is happy, thanks again you can mark as solved.
